de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.simengine
Class Simulator

java.lang.Object
  de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.simengine.Simulator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Configurable
public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Configurable

Concrete implementation of a simulator which can be used to run a simulation by calling the main method in the SimulatorRunner class.

Version:
3.0, 11/29/2007
Author:
Sebastian Kaune, Konstantin Pussep

          Returns the current simulation unit value.
static Simulator getInstance()
          Returns the single instance of the SimulationFramework
static Monitor getMonitor()
          Returns the global monitor which can be used to delegate information/occured events to a specific analyzer/s.
static org.apache.commons.math.random.RandomGenerator getRandom()
          This method provides the global random generator which has to be used within the simulation framework to generate reproducable results depending on a predefined seed.
static long getSeed()
          Returns the seed used within a simulation run.
static java.lang.String getSimulatedRealtime()
          Returns the simulated realtime in the format (Hours:Minutes:Seconds).

          Inserts new event in queue
 void setFinishAt(long endTime)
          Sets the end time at which the simulation framework will finish at the latest the simulation , irrespective if there are still unprocessed events in the event queue.
 void setMonitor(Monitor monitor)
          Sets the monitor which has to be configured by using the XML file with the configuration data.
 void setScenario(Scenario scenario)
          Set the scenario (protocol stack, network topology etc.) which will be used to run the simulation.
 void setSeed(long seed)
          This method sets the seed of the global random generator which can be obtained using the static getRandom()-method.
 void start()
          This method will run the simulation using the previously set scenario data.

getRandom

public static org.apache.commons.math.random.RandomGenerator getRandom()
This method provides the global random generator which has to be used within the simulation framework to generate reproducable results depending on a predefined seed.

Returns:
the global random generator with a predefined seed.

setFinishAt

public void setFinishAt(long endTime)
Sets the end time at which the simulation framework will finish at the latest the simulation , irrespective if there are still unprocessed events in the event queue.

Parameters:
endTime - point in time at which the simular will finish at the latest
